data.note: The budget approved in June 2015 allocated KES 14.9bn ($147bn) to rural electrification, KES 4.5bn ($44.4m) for street lighting and KES 1.5bn ($14.8bn) for last-mile connectivity. These figures do not include additional financing from donors and development finance  institutions.
data.name: Rural electrification budget

data.note: Under its Last Mile connectivity project Kenya Power is connecting any household within a 600-metre radius of a transformer at a subsidised cost of KES 15,000 ($150). The programme is expected to reach a total of 625,000 households.
data.name: New connection cost
